Second gauging of the day for @EnvAgencySW . River Fowey@ Restormel. Approx 39 cumecs. One of the Crown Jewels of Devon and Cornwall gauges- there is a major abstraction supplying most of Cornwall’s drinking water, plus it lies upstream of Lostwithiel, so is key for #floodwarning https://t.co/fAH8040xcQ

urls.title: Agenda: World Water-Tech Innovation Summit, February 23-24, 2021
urls.description: Discover the agenda, speakers and water leaders joining the World Water-Tech Innovation Summit on February 23-24, 2021. The rich programme covers core water and wastewater technology and investment, offering water management solutions and strategies to tackle challenges including water leakage, non-revenue water, water digitisation, and water finance, connecting leading international water utilities and technology providers, water innovators and startups with water investors and regulators. Interactive water workshop roundtables and seminar, speed networking and more.

text: As the urgency around flood resilience increases, our dedicated Flooding Track will deep dive into the strategies being implemented by municipalities at #WorldWaterTech. Hear exciting insights from @EnvAgency @bergenkommune @StEB_Koeln @EPCOR: https://t.co/Xs6M1RnxLG https://t.co/EDvft7tGVF

@Feargal_Sharkey @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency Indeed. According to various sources it is at times one of the most polluted waterways in the world. Also a precious chalkstream.

@UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @Feargal_Sharkey @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil The Deephams Sewage Treatment Works pours mind-boggling quantities of sewage into the Lee/Lea just upstream from here sadly. @EnvAgency waits for @thameswater to ask to be fined as they don't actively monitor. @LDNWaterkeeper is actively trying to combat this

text: @MerryAlbright @fbuner @Feargal_Sharkey I wonder, but I suspect that if they were all shut down tomorrow P levels would still exceed limits. Pretty much ALL of agriculture is contributing. Problem is we don't have sufficiently intensive monitoring by @NatResWales and @EnvAgency to produce sensitive enough models.

text: @NWFishEA @FishFarmEA @EnvAgencyNW Darren's been busy today!! Top work

Low tide, and the rivers in Truro are swollen. It’s usually just a trickle.

We’re prepared for a busy afternoon. Hear from the @EnvAgencySW @KWTWeather @CORMACltd on the phone-in @BBCCornwall. https://t.co/aza9zLINII
@WildStoke @StaffsUni @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @StaffsUniNews Superb stuff.  We'll done!

The @RoyalSocBio ran a #scienceathome festival in Nov. Josie from our National Monitoring Field Team was interviewed about her role and working in science. Check the link to find out more https://t.co/4uoa5xUR2M @EnvAgency #environment #science #workinginscience

@h2010000 @fishfacejohnny @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm You ask the question what can he do? It’s very simple, what every landowner should. Apply for the correct permit to conduct the works to manage the river bank that he intends to conduct. When turned down work with the permitting authority to manage the bank correctly.
@Feargal_Sharkey @SaveLeaMarshes @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency he means the river lea

Tree-planting at our new water storage areas in Row End and the Naddle - part of our Glenderamackin catchment natural flood management project. Trees and scrub will increase habitat and biodiversity. Thanks to @EnvAgencyNW #WEG https://t.co/LaM6SSHivp

@h2010000 @fishfacejohnny @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm I agree there’s a lot of people with very little experience in these organisations. Dredging rivers is not the solutions. The EA specifically stated to clear the 3rd arch of silt and managing afew section of bank which were eroding and causing silt. Not bulldoze the whole bank.
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil The stretch of Lee that runs through that p…

@NWFishEA @FishFarmEA @EnvAgencyNW Thanks, is there grayling in the lune?
I caught a pike about 8lb just below Skelton weir about 20 years ago, I returned it, it might still be there.

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service – your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

text:
If you ask or pay someone else to remove your waste – make sure they are registered with the @EnvAgency.  Check online https://t.co/HYUGXUF37i or ask the carrier for their certificate before handing the waste over.

Report fly-tipping: https://t.co/hTQEb7MOZ9
